intro: Hypoestes cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
